name: MAST Single-cell differential expression
description: Run a MAST differential expression analysis on your single-cell data. Depending on your needs, you may choose to compare one group/cluster of cells versus the rest, in essence running a biomarker analysis. Alternatively, you may choose to run an explicit comparison of two groups/clusters.

SctkMastDge.raw_counts.description: The input raw count matrix. Must be an integer-based table.
SctkMastDge.raw_counts.name: Count matrix:

SctkMastDge.expSamples.description: The group of cells which is considered the "experimental" group. In a biomarker-style analysis, this group will be compared to the remaining cells which will act as a "control" group.
SctkMastDge.expSamples.name: Experimental or group of interest:

SctkMastDge.baseSamples.description: The group of cells which is considered the "control" group. In a biomarker-style analysis, this is left blank. This field is only used if you wish to explicitly compare two groups of interest.
SctkMastDge.baseSamples.name: Base or control group:

SctkMastDge.expGroupName.description: A name for your experimental group of cells.
SctkMastDge.expGroupName.name: Experimental group name:

SctkMastDge.baseGroupName.description: A name for your control group. In a biomarker-style analysis, your "control" group is the collection of all other cells in your dataset.
SctkMastDge.baseGroupName.name: Control group name
